security: The document discusses the Frente Interno de Unidad Revolucionaria (FIUR) and its activities, potentially impacting U.S. relations with Cuba and Cuban exile groups. The document is marked Confidential. Directly quoting the document, 'This material contains information affecting the National Defense of the United States within the meaning of the Espionage Laws...the transmission or revelation of which in any manner to an unauthorized person is prohibited by law.'
summary: A CIA information report details the Frente Interno de Unidad Revolucionaria (FIUR), a Cuban revolutionary group, and the claims of Julio V. Leal, who asserts to be the US Delegate of the 'Cuban Government in Arms.' The report questions the authenticity of documents provided by Leal regarding appointments to a provisional Cuban government.
summary_one_paragraph: This CIA information report, dated May 27, 1963, relays information regarding the Frente Interno de Unidad Revolucionaria (FIUR) gathered from a Cuban national residing in the United States; it focuses on Julio V. Leal, who claims to represent the 'Cuban Government in Arms' and possesses documents outlining appointments within a provisional Cuban government, including names for various ministerial positions and ambassadors. The report casts doubt on Leal's legitimacy and the Cuban origin of the documents, suggesting they may be a fabrication by exiled Cuban politicians seeking publicity and support in the US.
title: Frente Interno de Unidad Revolucionaria (FIUR)
